types.name: CommittableBranch
types.description:
A git ref for a commit to be appended to.

The ref must be a branch, i.e. its fully qualified name must start
with `refs/heads/` (although the input is not required to be fully
qualified).

The Ref may be specified by its global node ID or by the
repository nameWithOwner and branch name.

### Examples

Specify a branch using a global node ID:

    { "id": "MDM6UmVmMTpyZWZzL2hlYWRzL21haW4=" }

Specify a branch using nameWithOwner and branch name:

    {
      "nameWithOwner": "github/graphql-client",
      "branchName": "main"
    }

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The Node ID of the Ref to be updated.

inputFields.name: repositoryNameWithOwner
inputFields.description: The nameWithOwner of the repository to commit to.

inputFields.name: branchName
inputFields.description: The unqualified name of the branch to append the commit to.

fields.name: firstIssueContribution
fields.description: The first issue the user opened on GitHub. This will be null if that issue was opened outside the collection's time range and ignoreTimeRange is false. If the issue is not visible but the user has opted to show private contributions, a RestrictedContribution will be returned.

fields.name: firstPullRequestContribution
fields.description: The first pull request the user opened on GitHub. This will be null if that pull request was opened outside the collection's time range and ignoreTimeRange is not true. If the pull request is not visible but the user has opted to show private contributions, a RestrictedContribution will be returned.

fields.name: firstRepositoryContribution
fields.description: The first repository the user created on GitHub. This will be null if that first repository was created outside the collection's time range and ignoreTimeRange is false. If the repository is not visible, then a RestrictedContribution is returned.

fields.description: Does the user have any more activity in the timeline that occurred prior to the collection's time range?

fields.description: Determine if there are any contributions in this collection.

fields.name: hasAnyRestrictedContributions
fields.description: Determine if the user made any contributions in this time frame whose details are not visible because they were made in a private repository. Can only be true if the user enabled private contribution counts.

fields.name: isSingleDay
fields.description: Whether or not the collector's time span is all within the same day.

fields.description: ASCII-armored signature header from object.

fields.description: GitHub user corresponding to the email signing this commit.

types.name: GitSignatureState
types.description: The state of a Git signature.

enumValues.name: VALID
enumValues.description: Valid signature and verified by GitHub

enumValues.name: INVALID
enumValues.description: Invalid signature

enumValues.name: MALFORMED_SIG
enumValues.description: Malformed signature

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN_KEY
enumValues.description: Key used for signing not known to GitHub

enumValues.name: BAD_EMAIL
enumValues.description: Invalid email used for signing

enumValues.name: UNVERIFIED_EMAIL
enumValues.description: Email used for signing unverified on GitHub

enumValues.name: NO_USER
enumValues.description: Email used for signing not known to GitHub

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN_SIG_TYPE
enumValues.description: Unknown signature type

enumValues.name: UNSIGNED
enumValues.description: Unsigned

enumValues.name: GPGVERIFY_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: Internal error - the GPG verification service is unavailable at the moment

enumValues.name: GPGVERIFY_ERROR
enumValues.description: Internal error - the GPG verification service misbehaved

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNING_KEY
enumValues.description: The usage flags for the key that signed this don't allow signing

enumValues.name: EXPIRED_KEY
enumValues.description: Signing key expired

enumValues.name: OCSP_PENDING
enumValues.description: Valid signature, pending certificate revocation checking

enumValues.name: OCSP_ERROR
enumValues.description: Valid signature, though certificate revocation check failed

enumValues.name: BAD_CERT
enumValues.description: The signing certificate or its chain could not be verified

enumValues.name: OCSP_REVOKED
enumValues.description: One or more certificates in chain has been revoked

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: createCommitOnBranch
fields.description:
Appends a commit to the given branch as the authenticated user.

This mutation creates a commit whose parent is the HEAD of the provided
branch and also updates that branch to point to the new commit.
It can be thought of as similar to `git commit`.

### Locating a Branch

Commits are appended to a `branch` of type `Ref`.
This must refer to a git branch (i.e.  the fully qualified path must
begin with `refs/heads/`, although including this prefix is optional.

Callers may specify the `branch` to commit to either by its global node
ID or by passing both of `repositoryNameWithOwner` and `refName`.  For
more details see the documentation for `CommittableBranch`.

### Describing Changes

`fileChanges` are specified as a `FilesChanges` object describing
`FileAdditions` and `FileDeletions`.

Please see the documentation for `FileChanges` for more information on
how to use this argument to describe any set of file changes.

### Authorship

Similar to the web commit interface, this mutation does not support
specifying the author or committer of the commit and will not add
support for this in the future.

A commit created by a successful execution of this mutation will be
authored by the owner of the credential which authenticates the API
request.  The committer will be identical to that of commits authored
using the web interface.

If you need full control over author and committer information, please
use the Git Database REST API instead.

### Commit Signing

Commits made using this mutation are automatically signed by GitHub if
supported and will be marked as verified in the user interface.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateCommitOnBranch

types.name: OrgRemoveMemberAuditEntryMembershipType
types.description: The type of membership a user has with an Organization.

enumValues.name: DIRECT_MEMBER
enumValues.description: A direct member is a user that is a member of the Organization.

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: Organization administrators have full access and can change several settings, including the names of repositories that belong to the Organization and Owners team membership. In addition, organization admins can delete the organization and all of its repositories.

enumValues.name: BILLING_MANAGER
enumValues.description: A billing manager is a user who manages the billing settings for the Organization, such as updating payment information.

enumValues.name: UNAFFILIATED
enumValues.description: An unaffiliated collaborator is a person who is not a member of the Organization and does not have access to any repositories in the Organization.

enumValues.name: OUTSIDE_COLLABORATOR
enumValues.description: An outside collaborator is a person who isn't explicitly a member of the Organization, but who has Read, Write, or Admin permissions to one or more repositories in the organization.

types.name: OrgRemoveMemberAuditEntryReason
types.description: The reason a member was removed from an Organization.

enumValues.name: TWO_FACTOR_REQUIREMENT_NON_COMPLIANCE
enumValues.description: The organization required 2FA of its billing managers and this user did not have 2FA enabled.

enumValues.name: SAML_EXTERNAL_IDENTITY_MISSING
enumValues.description: SAML external identity missing

enumValues.name: SAML_SSO_ENFORCEMENT_REQUIRES_EXTERNAL_IDENTITY
enumValues.description: SAML SSO enforcement requires an external identity

enumValues.name: USER_ACCOUNT_DELETED
enumValues.description: User account has been deleted

enumValues.name: TWO_FACTOR_ACCOUNT_RECOVERY
enumValues.description: User was removed from organization during account recovery

types.name: OrgUpdateMemberRepositoryCreationPermissionAuditEntryVisibility
types.description: The permissions available for repository creation on an Organization.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating any repositories.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC
enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating public repositories.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: All organization members are allowed to create any repositories.

enumValues.name: PRIVATE
enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating private repositories.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL
enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating internal repositories.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC_INTERNAL
enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating public or internal repositories.

enumValues.name: PRIVATE_INTERNAL
enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating private or internal repositories.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC_PRIVATE
enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating public or private repositories.

fields.name: marketplaceCategories
fields.description: Get alphabetically sorted list of Marketplace categories

args.name: includeCategories
args.description: Return only the specified categories.

args.name: excludeEmpty
args.description: Exclude categories with no listings.

args.name: excludeSubcategories
args.description: Returns top level categories only, excluding any subcategories.

fields.description: Look up a Marketplace category by its slug.

args.name: slug
args.description: The URL slug of the category.

args.name: useTopicAliases
args.description: Also check topic aliases for the category slug

fields.name: marketplaceListing
fields.description: Look up a single Marketplace listing

args.name: slug
args.description: Select the listing that matches this slug. It's the short name of the listing used in its URL.

fields.name: marketplaceListings
fields.description: Look up Marketplace listings

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: categorySlug
args.description: Select only listings with the given category.

args.name: useTopicAliases
args.description: Also check topic aliases for the category slug

args.name: viewerCanAdmin
args.description:
Select listings to which user has admin access. If omitted, listings visible to the
viewer are returned.

args.name: adminId
args.description: Select listings that can be administered by the specified user.

args.name: organizationId
args.description: Select listings for products owned by the specified organization.

args.name: allStates
args.description:
Select listings visible to the viewer even if they are not approved. If omitted or
false, only approved listings will be returned.

args.name: slugs
args.description: Select the listings with these slugs, if they are visible to the viewer.

args.name: primaryCategoryOnly
args.description: Select only listings where the primary category matches the given category slug.

args.name: withFreeTrialsOnly
args.description: Select only listings that offer a free trial.

args.description: Ordering options for users and organizations returned from the connection.

args.name: onlyDependencies
args.description: Whether only sponsorables who own the viewer's dependencies will be returned. Must be authenticated to use. Can check an organization instead for their dependencies owned by sponsorables by passing orgLoginForDependencies.

args.name: orgLoginForDependencies
args.description: Optional organization username for whose dependencies should be checked. Used when onlyDependencies = true. Omit to check your own dependencies. If you are not an administrator of the organization, only dependencies from its public repositories will be considered.

args.name: dependencyEcosystem
args.description: Optional filter for which dependencies should be checked for sponsorable owners. Only sponsorable owners of dependencies in this ecosystem will be included. Used when onlyDependencies = true.

types.name: RepoChangeMergeSettingAuditEntryMergeType
types.description: The merge options available for pull requests to this repository.

enumValues.name: MERGE
enumValues.description: The pull request is added to the base branch in a merge commit.

enumValues.name: REBASE
enumValues.description: Commits from the pull request are added onto the base branch individually without a merge commit.

enumValues.name: SQUASH
enumValues.description: The pull request's commits are squashed into a single commit before they are merged to the base branch.

types.name: SecurityVulnerability
types.description: An individual vulnerability within an Advisory

fields.name: advisory
fields.description: The Advisory associated with this Vulnerability

fields.name: firstPatchedVersion
fields.description: The first version containing a fix for the vulnerability

fields.name: package
fields.description: A description of the vulnerable package

fields.name: severity
fields.description: The severity of the vulnerability within this package

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When the vulnerability was last updated

fields.name: vulnerableVersionRange
fields.description:
A string that describes the vulnerable package versions.
This string follows a basic syntax with a few forms.
+ `= 0.2.0` denotes a single vulnerable version.
+ `<= 1.0.8` denotes a version range up to and including the specified version
+ `< 0.1.11` denotes a version range up to, but excluding, the specified version
+ `>= 4.3.0, < 4.3.5` denotes a version range with a known minimum and maximum version.
+ `>= 0.0.1` denotes a version range with a known minimum, but no known maximum

enumValues.name: CHILD_TEAM

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Includes immediate and child team members for the team.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
